thread.title: Matt Damon says it took 12 hours to get extensions in | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Matt Damon says it took 12 hours to get extensions in | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.Com Reporter
title: Matt Damon says it took 12 hours to get extensions in | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share But after five months of long hair, Matt couldn't wait to get rid of the 'rat's nest' on his head. 'It was so gross:' While his family may have enjoyed seeing him with all that hair, the actor sounded pretty happy to get it cut off. Here he is in a still from The Great Wall He told E! News : 'I flew from China and went to do a day of extra filming on The Martian and so I flew to Hungary, landed, went into the production office, and cut all that hair off, and left it on the floor on Hungary.' 'It was a rat's nest...It was so gross. It was so nasty.' While Matt can be seen shooting a bow and arrow in his new movie - in which he plays an English mercenary who finds himself battling monsters in ancient China - he admits all was not as it seemed and he is certainly not in a position to try his skills against Jennifer Lawrence, who used similar weaponry to great success in the Hunger Games franchise. War hero: The 46-year-old plays an English mercenary in a monster battle in the film. Here he is with actor Pedro Pascal (left) Matt admitted: 'With a CGI arrow, I'm pretty damn good. But with an actual arrow, not so much.' 'She's got a good grasp on that whole thing. I think she's got me beat.' The Great Wall hits theaters this Friday. Happy man: The Academy Award winner attended the Oscars Nominee Luncheon in Beverly Hills, California earlier this month
